task_description: Facing the building to your North-West (approx. 323°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the full extent of the building to estimate its height, so I will start by looking up to find the roof.
I still cannot see the top of the building, so I need to tilt my view further upwards to find the roofline.
I can now see the top of the building, so I will look down to see the base and get a complete view for my height estimation.

I have now seen the top and the bottom of the building; the ground floor appears to be about 4 meters high, and there are approximately 10 floors above it, each about 3 meters, plus a roof structure, leading to an estimate of 4 + (10 * 3) + 2 = 36 meters.
